title: Gamescom 2025 schedule: all of the dates, times, and what to expect
description: Find a breakdown of all of the events, dates, and times, and what games you can expect from the Gamescom 2025 schedule
content:
The Gamescom 2025 schedule is not only packed with exciting playable demos for some of the biggest new games for 2025 and beyond, but it will also kick off with fresh announcements and updates on some of the most highly anticipated future releases in the main Opening Night Live 2025 showcase. And as if that wasn't enough already, we can also expect to see broadcasts from some major publishers, including the likes of Xbox and Bethesda, which is a great way to experience the event if you can't make it in person yourself.

Taking place once again in Cologne, Germany, Gamescom 2025 already looks set to bring us a lot of gaming goodness, from news that the long-awaited Hollow Knight: Silksong will have a playable demo on the showfloor, to confirmation that Nintendo will also have a presence this year with some upcoming Switch 2 games. Plus, a new reveal of Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 will be coming, and much more.

With Gamescom just a matter of weeks away now that August has arrived, we've brought together all of the major shows and highlighted some of the biggest attendees to give you a helpful overview of the Gamescom 2025 schedule ahead of time so you can get ready for the upcoming event. Read on below to see what's in store, along with a detailed breakdown of dates and timings for everything that's ahead.

Gamescom is an annual gaming event that takes place in the Koelnmesse in Cologne, Germany. Open to the public over the course of several days, the event offers up the chance to try out some of the biggest upcoming PC games, upcoming Xbox Series X games, and upcoming PS5 games ahead of their release, or some of the most recent releases that have already landed.

Gamescom runs from August 20 - August 24. Attendance will be open the public from August 21, with trade visitors, media and select ticket holders gaining entry on August 20. The main showcase, Opening Night Live, will be on August 19 (more on that below) to kick off the event.

What will be at Gamescom 2025?

Gamescom 2025 looks set to be the biggest event yet, with lots of big publishers and developers attending with some exciting new games set to be available to play on the show floor. For starters, Xbox announced it will be bringing 20 titles to Gamescom this year, with a playable demo of Hollow Knight Silksong on PC and its new portable console, the ROG Xbox Ally X.

Other playable demos from Xbox's third-party partners include the likes of Borderlands 4, PowerWash Simulator 2, Cronos: The New Dawn, Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater, Super Meat Boy 3D, There Are No Ghosts at the Grand, and more. Outside of Xbox's demos, it's also going to bring a theater experience to the event for the highly anticipated upcoming Obsidian game, The Outer Worlds 2.

After skipping Gamescom last year, Nintendo confirmed its attendance this year with some exciting demos for the Switch and Switch 2 – most notably for Metroid Prime 4: Beyond and Pokemon Legends Z-A. Some big games from Bandai Namco will also be appearing with a hands-on demo of Little Nightmares 3 and a "chance to immerse yourselves in the universe of The Blood of Dawnwalker". With other games like Crimson Desert available, there's certainly going to be plenty to experience – you can see more games that will be at the event here.

When: August 19 at 11am PDT / 2pm EDT / 7pm BST / 8pm CEST

Where to watch: YouTube / Twitch

Games Opening Night Live 2025 is the main show that kickstarts the Gamescom event to follow. Hosted by Geoff Keighley, its expected to run for two hours with an expected end time of 1pm PT / 4pm ET / 10pm CEST / 9pm BST and promises to bring us new game announcements, trailer and gameplay reveals, a first look at Gamescom events, and talks with developers and prominent guests. While we're sure to be in for some surprises, we also know that we can expect to see Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 get a reveal during the showcase.

When: August 20 at 6am PDT / 9am EDT / 2pm BST / 3pm CEST 

Where to watch: YouTube / Twitch / TikTok 



Xbox is also going to be holding some broadcast streams over the course of Gamescom 2025, with the first kicking off on August 20th the day after Opening Night Live. Streamed live from the Xbox booth, you can expect to see deep dives into some highly anticipated games, with some first-look gameplay, developer interviews, updates, and fresh trailers. The first broadcast is set to focus on the new ROG Xbox Ally handhelds, as well as Grounded 2, Keeper from Psychonauts developer, Double Fine, Call of Duty: Black Ops 7, and more.

When: August 20 at 11am PDT / 2pm EDT / 7pm BST / 8pm CEST 

Where to watch: YouTube / Twitch

The Future Games Show will be returning to Gamescom this year with a broadcast that promises to bring us world premiers, new trailers, and deep dives on some upcoming games. The showcase will be hosted by actors David Hayter, who played Metal Gear Solid's Snake, and Maggie Roberston who's best known for her role as Lady Dimitrescu in Resident Evil Village.

The second Xbox broadcast live from the event is set to follow suit from the first by bringing us more deep dives, interviews and looks at some new games coming from Xbox's partners. In this stream, you can see more of two of the biggest releases coming our way this October, with Ninja Gaiden 4 and The Outer Worlds 2. We can also expect to see some updates on Overwatch 2, and more.

When: August 21 at 9am PDT / 12pm EDT / 5pm BST / 6pm CEST

Where to watch: YouTube / Twitch

Gamescom Awesome Indies 2025 is set to bring the international indie scene into the spotlight by showcases independent developers, studios, and publishers as they unveil some exciting upcoming indie games. Set to bring us exclusive trailers, first looks at debut gameplay, it promises to bring us some "amazing premiers and exciting newcomers" in the world of indie games.

Bethesda is bringing back its broadcast livestream at Gamescom this year, which is set to begin on August 22 and will run for three days. With a series of live streams from the Xbox show floor, you can expect to see developer interviews, game showcases, community segments, tours of the Gamescom event, and crafting highlights throughout.
summary: The Gamescom 2025 schedule includes exciting playable demos for some of the biggest new games for 2025 and beyond, and will also feature updates on some highly anticipated future releases in the main Opening Night Live 2025 showcase. Major publishers, including Xbox and Bethesda, are expected to participate in broadcasts from major publishers. The event, held in Cologne, Germany, will also be broadcasted live from the Xbox booth and will be open to the public from August 20 - August 24. The main showcase, opening Night Live, will be on August 19, with a playable demo of Hollow Knight Silksong on PC and its new portable console, the ROG Xbox Ally X. Xbox will also bring 20 titles to Gamescom this year, including those from its third-party partners, Borderlands 4, PowerWash Simulator 2, Cronos: The New Dawn, Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater, Super Meat Boy 3D, There Are No Ghosts at the Grand, and more. Nintendo confirmed its attendance with some exciting demos for the Switch and Switch 2 games.
shortSummary: The Gamescom 2025 in Cologne, Germany, will feature exciting playable demos, major publishers, and extensive gameplay reveals, with major events like Xbox and Nintendo participating.

You simply will not guess the main character of the Psychonauts studio and Brutal Legend art director's new mind-bending adventure
A lighthouse... you play as a damn cute lighthouse
Double Fine Productions just announced its first game in four years: Keeper, which is about a walking lighthouse, because of course it is.
The Psychonauts studio has been quiet for a while, but it just reared both of its heads at the Xbox Game Showcase 2025 to reveal a third-person adventure game that's intentionally hard to categorize. There are some puzzles, some exploration, lots of mind-bending sights, and, gosh darn, how did they make a lighthouse cute!?
The setup is that a stray bird causes a really old lighthouse to crumble down. Then, somehow, the lighthouse stands using ingrown roots as its feet, pat-pat-pattering across a fantastical world while trying not to topple over again. You can help it along its way when Keeper comes to Xbox Series X|S, PC, and Game Pass on October 17, 2025.
Double Fine has multiple projects in development right now, and this one's led by Lee Petty, who was previously the art director on the metal open world Brutal Legend and the main game director of Rad, Headhunter, and Stacking. Petty made Keeper with a slightly different approach, though.
"When it came time to work on a new project, Lee was keen to start from a place that could not be so simply categorized by its genre, defined by its mechanics, or summarized by its setting," an Xbox Wire blog explains. "Instead, he wanted to explore the blurring of genres and to create room for something more atmospheric – a space for the player to really live inside, and take in the vibes."
Keeper apparently spawned from the isolation Petty felt during the pandemic, around the time that Double Fine was wrapping up its last game, Psychonauts 2.
For now, check out the full Summer Game Fest schedule so you don't miss a single thing.
Weekly digests, tales from the communities you love, and more
Kaan freelances for various websites including Rock Paper Shotgun, Eurogamer, and this one, Gamesradar. He particularly enjoys writing about spooky indies, throwback RPGs, and anything that's vaguely silly. Also has an English Literature and Film Studies degree that he'll soon forget.

Bandai Namco Entertainment Europe announces an exciting and diversified line-up for this year's gamescom.
Visitors will be treated to a playable demo of Towa and the Guardians of the Sacred Tree, a new hands-on demo for Little Nightmares III, and the opportunity to immerse themselves in the universe of The Blood of Dawnwalker. We look forward to welcoming you to the Bandai Namco booth which will be located in Hall 6, booth A20.
Towa and the Guardians of the Sacred Tree will invite players to defend Shinju Village against the evil Magatsu and his minions , in a 2D isometric roguelite set to launch on 19 September 2025 for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, Nintendo Switch and PC. Choose two Guardians, with each mastering their own abilities, and venture on quests in a vibrant world crafted with a beautiful hand-drawn style reminiscing of Japanese ink painting.
Little Nightmares III lifts the curtain on a new playable demo of this upcoming atmospheric adventure game. Players will step for the first time into the Carnevale, discovering that what should be a festival of fun and childlike wonder, is yet another grim place filled with danger and disturbing residents. Little Nightmares III will release on 10 October 2025 for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Switch 2 and PC.
The Blood of Dawnwalker will bring Vale Sangora to gamescom with decor and vampiric cosplayers straight out of the open world action RPG set in 14th century dark fantasy. The story revolves around Coen, a young man turned into a Dawnwalker, forever treading the line between the world of day and the realm of night. Developed by Rebel Wolves, The Blood of Dawnwalker will release in 2026 on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S and PC.

Upcoming PS5 games: New PS5 games for 2025 and beyond
With so many upcoming PS5 games to keep track of in August and beyond, this list does the remembering for you
We have lots of upcoming PS5 games to look forward to in the months ahead. In fact, August is set to bring us a ton of exciting titles, such as Gears of War: Reloaded and a new Mafia game. However, don't be fooled, 2025 is a massive year for gaming in general. There are still plenty of new PS5 games to keep track of, from PS5 exclusives to big third-party games, as we officially pass the halfway mark of the year.
Sure, our list of the best games of 2025 is already stacked with the likes of Monster Hunter Wilds and Split Fiction, but following a slew of announcements (thanks to the likes of the State of Play June showcase and Summer Game Fest Live 2025), Sony fans are being fed each and every month. We still have the likes of Ghost of Yotei to look forward to, a ton of upcoming indie games, and a Borderlands sequel on its way. That's not even mentioning long-awaited PS5 releases of hit PC and Xbox games such as Senua's Saga: Hellblade II, now confirmed to be heading to our Sony consoles as well.
There's a lot to remember, so to help you keep track of everything, we've created a helpful roundup of all the new games for 2025 and beyond set to come to the platform. Read on below to see all the upcoming PS5 games on the way, listed in release date order for easy browsing.
Upcoming PS5 games to watch out for
2025
Mafia: The Old Country
Developer: Hangar 13
Publisher: 2K
Release date: August 8, 2025
Mafia: The Old Country was announced during Gamescom Opening Night Live 2024, and we couldn't be more excited about it. Set during 1900s Sicily, the new game is based on Mafia's origins and is taking the series back to its roots. Recently, we got a new trailer for this one as well as a shiny new release date. We'll keep you posted as more details head our way. Until then, at least we can rest easy knowing that we’ll be exploring the town of San Celeste once again in August this year.
Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2
Developer: Ninja Theory
Publisher: Xbox Game Studios
Release date: August 12, 2025
Originally released as a console exclusive on Xbox Series X, developer Ninja Theory announced Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2 is getting optimized in an enhanced edition with new features for PS5 and PS5 Pro. As the sequel to Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice which released in 2017, Hellblade 2 is a dark adventure steeped in myth that you find out more about in our glowing Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2 review.
Weekly digests, tales from the communities you love, and more
Madden NFL 26
Developer: EA Orlando
Publisher: EA Sports
Release date: August 14, 2025
Madden NFL 26 is the follow up to the best sports game of 2024, Madden NFL 25. Based on the National Football League, it's up to players to take their teams to victory, through smart plays and strategic decisions. What we are most excited about for this upcoming PS5 game are the improvements that have reportedly been made to the Franchise mode. Draft logic, team needs logic and sim stats have all been retooled. Hopefully the changes are great ones and we get another hit on our hands!
Sword of the Sea
Developer: Giant Squid
Publisher: Giant Squid
Release date: August 19, 2025
Ever wondered whether Journey would be massively improved with a sword? Well, that's what Sword of the Sea looks to be offering. Developed alongside former Thatgamecompany artist, who helped shape the iconic look of indies like Flow, Flower, and Journey, this beautiful indie looks set to put a focus on exploration and free-flowing navigation, with your armament used not only for defense but hyperkinetic sand-surfing too. Sword of the Sea honestly looks like a real delight, and one we can't wait to see more of.
Discounty
Developer: Crinkle Cut Games
Publisher: PQube
Release date: August 21, 2025
Let's be honest most cozy games follow the premise of a character moving to the countryside and leaving the big corporate lifestyle behind. Unless you choose the Joja Mart path in Stardew Valley (you monsters) this is a genre that has you fighting gentrification. However, Discounty turns everything on its head, letting you be the "bad guy". Run your own discount supermarket, make deals, expand, and see how the community reacts when no one can compete with your low prices.
Gears of War: Reloaded
Developer: The Coalition
Publisher: Xbox Game Studios
Release date: August 26, 2025
Gears of War: Reloaded is a remaster of the original Gears of War game, and shockingly, it's coming to PS5! We say "shocking" because the Gears franchise is historically an Xbox-only affair, given the fact that the games are published by Xbox Game Studios. So, yeah, Gears of War: Reloaded being on our list of upcoming PS5 games is a very big deal and means that you’ll be able to experience one of the best shooters of all time on your console of choice. Sign us up!
Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater Remake
Developer: In-house
Publisher: Konami
Release date: August 28, 2025
It's been almost 20 years since the release of Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater and its legend has only spiraled out of control in that time. Thankfully, Konami is working to introduce one of the best PS2 games to a whole new generation of players with a Metal Gear Solid 3 remake for PS5. While we're yet to get any concrete details apart from trailers on the expected changes or a look at any real-time gameplay, we are keen to see what steps Konami will take to modernize this exceptionally important (and extraordinary) stealth-action game.
Shinobi: Art of Vengeance
Developer: SEGA
Publisher: SEGA
Release date: August 28, 2025
One of the most surprising and exciting new PS5 games announced during the February State of Play showcase was the upcoming 2D action platformer, Shinobi: Art of Vengeance. Created by the team behind Streets of Rage 4, Shinobi: Art of Vengeance is packed with style. From the clips and trailers we've seen so far, there's stunning art, and snappy gameplay, that every Hollow Knight fan will enjoy. You'll get to play the role of the ninja Shinobi Joe Musashi who, after finding is home destroyed, embarks on a quest for vengeance. With multiple environments and puzzles to solve along the way, Shinobi: Art of Vengeance has plenty to offer to keep you busy this August.
Lost Soul Aside
Developer: Ultizero Games
Publisher: Sony
Release date: August 29, 2025
Lost Soul Aside is a new, original action RPG from Shanghai-based studio Ultizero that sees you take on the role of protagonist Kaser as he sets out to find his sister, whose soul has been taken by beings known as the Voidrax. With big bosses to face and plenty of enemies to tackle with its action-oriented combat system complete with combos, Lost Soul Aside promises to test your reflexes!
Hirogami
Developer: Bandai Namco Studios Singapore
Publisher: Bandai Namco Entertainment
Release date: September 3, 2025
Hirogami is a stunning new PS5 game on the way in 2025, and it's one of the most unique and strangely peaceful adventure experiences yet. Exploring a vast, paper-folded world as protagonist Hiro, you'll be able to turn into various new creations – like foxes or frogs, for example – to help navigate your surroundings. Hirogami looks bursting with colorful vistas, intricate traversal puzzles, and plenty of hostile enemies as Hiro fights back against "deadly digital invaders", according to the game's Steam page, and we only have to wait a few months for its September release.
Hell is Us
Developer: Rogue Factor
Publisher: Nacon
Release date: September 4, 2025
Hell is Us is an upcoming adventure game set in a war torn country that also happens to be packed with supernatural creatures. Exploration is at the heart of the new PS5 game, but there is also plenty of combat on offer to keep action fans entertained as well. We're super intrigued about the world on display in Hell is Us. It looks pretty original, and we are curious about the underlying story behind the setting, and faceless white monsters. Hopefully, we hear more news on Hell is Us soon!
Everybody's Golf: Hot Shots
Developer: HYDE, Inc.
Publisher: Bandai Namco Entertainment Inc.
Release date: September 4, 2025
Golfing makes for some of the best sports games around, so of course, we are excited about Everybody's Golf: Hot Shots. Aim, time your shots right, and watch as golf balls fly after your club hits them with a satisfying "clunk". This upcoming PS5 game is also one that offers both solo and multiplayer options, allowing up to four players on local co-op as well as online options. Personally, we're intrigued about the Challenge Mode feature, where you’ll work through the ranks and face off during different rounds.
Cronos: The New Dawn
Developer: Bloober Team
Publisher: Bloober Team SA
Release date: September 5, 2025
Cronos: The New Dawn is an upcoming horror game that will be hitting the PS5 sometime in 2025. Revealed during Summer Game Fest 2025, this sci-fi survival horror looks to be what happens if Outlast and Dead Space 2 had a baby as you navigate a terrifying world with mutated "orphans" ready to kill you at the drop of a hat. Survive the nightmare, stop more destruction, and put on your big boy pants for this new thrill ride.
Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion
Developer: Marvelous Inc.
Publisher: Marvelous Europe Limited
Release date: September 5, 2025
Daemon X Machina was first released back in 2019, and now, years later, we are finally getting a sequel with the upcoming PS5 game, Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion. In a sci-fi world gripped by war, it's up to you and your customized Arsenal to blast and destroy everyone in your way. With mechs for days and plenty of explosions in the trailer for Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion, this new PS5 game seems to be a must-play for any anime and action fans. Hopefully, we will learn more details closer to its September release date as well!
Baby Steps
Developer: Gabe Cuzzillo, Maxi Boch, Bennett Foddy
Publisher: Devolver Digital
Release date: September 8, 2025
In our Baby Steps preview, we mention how out of all the upcoming PS5 games heading our way this year, this one is probably the title that'll make you break out in a smile. Here you play as 35-year-old Nate, a loser in a sweat-stained onesie, who is tasked with a massive challenge: getting off the couch and stepping outside his home. The new game is a self-described "walking simulator" that looks like it'll be both a challenge and hilarious. We can't wait to see more of this one for sure.
Borderlands 4
Developer: Gearbox Software
Publisher: 2K Games
Release date: September 12, 2025
Gamescom 2024 shocked the world when it announced that Borderlands 4 is on its way. That's right, we are getting another sci-fi looter shooter, and we couldn't be happier. The upcoming game will see us exploring new alien worlds, as we say goodbye to Pandora for now. With new lands to uncover, treasure to claim, and enemies to shoot in the head, Borderlands 4 promises to be one of the most exciting new PS5 games heading our way in September 2025.
Dying Light: The Beast
Developer: Techland
Publisher: Techland
Release date: September 19, 2025
Kyle Crane is making a comeback in the new game Dying Light: The Beast. Revealed during Gamescom 2024, this is the first new entry in the iconic horror franchise since 2022's Dying Light 2. It originally started as a DLC for said game before morphing into a standalone title. From the game's trailer, we know that players will control a super-powered Crane (who has been infected with zombie DNA) as he sets out on a quest for revenge. This upcoming horror game, will be heading our way in September!
Sonic Racing CrossWorlds
Developer: Sega
Publisher: Sega
Release date: September 25, 2025
Sonic Racing CrossWorlds is a new racing game from Sega that is set to let you speed around in a different way. Yes, instead of zipping around as the fast hedgehog, you'll be hitting the roads in the Sonic universe as a roster of different iconic characters. We've only gotten a brief teaser so far, but CrossWorlds promises to "transport racing fans into a new dimension".
Silent Hill f
Developer: NeoBards Entertainment Ltd.
Publisher: Konami
Release date: September 25, 2025
The first Silent Hill game that isn't set in the US, Silent Hill f, is set to usher in a new dawn for Konami's iconic horror series. In this upcoming PS5 game, you'll take on the role of Shimizu Hinako (a regular high school girl) who finds her hometown covered in a mysterious fog. Soon, your surroundings will turn into the stuff of nightmares, and you'll have to face monsters lurking in the shadows. Silent Hill f looks fantastic, from what we've seen already, and is one of the most exciting games on the docket for horror fans for sure!
EA Sports FC 26
Developer: EA Canada
Publisher: EA
Release date: September 26, 2025
When we talk about the contenders for the best sports game of 2025, EA Sports FC 26 is high on the list. Not only is it the latest outing in EA's football franchise, but it's also coming with many improvements to the formula that fans know and love. Build your dream squad for new Live Events and Tournament modes or dive into the newly revamped Manager Career. The game is set to launch in September, and we'll be grabbing a copy as soon as we can.
Pac-Man World 2 Re-Pac
Developer: NOW PRODUCTION Co., Ltd.
Publisher: Bandai Namco
Release date: September 26, 2025
A remake of the classic 2002 game, Pac-Man World 2, is coming to the PS5 this September. So get ready to step into a colourful 3D adventure as the iconic character! Pacland is in danger after those pesky ghosts have stolen the golden fruit, and it's up to our yellow circle-faced hero to retrieve them and save the day. Platform, explore, and meet a variety of cute characters on the way. The game was announced during a recent Nintendo Direct live stream and looks gorgeous. Definitely one to keep
NBA BOUNCE
Developer: Outright Games
Publisher: Outright Games
Release date: September 26, 2025
On the same day that we are getting EA Sports FC 26, a very cute-looking new basketball game is also heading to the PS5 for fans who prefer the court over the pitch. In this upcoming PS5 game, you'll get to choose from 30 NBA teams and win in order to go from rookie to pro. Unlock special jerseys, sneakers, and more, and grab a buddy if you want to experience the new game's co-op features as well.
Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles
Developer: Creative Studio III
Publisher: Square Enix
Release date: September 30, 2025
What's a JRPG without a tactical off-shoot? Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles is coming to PS5 later in 2025, offering both the 1997 classic and a refreshed Enhanced version. Those who opt for the shiny new edition will enjoy a litany of modern touches to optimize the experience, from improved graphics to fully-voiced gameplay and more, while the classic one stays true to its late-90s roots. Pre-orders are available right now, meaning it's the perfect time for FF fans to plan ahead this summer.
Ghost of Yotei
Developer: Sucker Punch
Publisher: Sony
Release date: October 2, 2025
That's right, we are finally getting a Ghost of Tsushima 2 with the upcoming PS5 game Ghost of Yotei. Set over 300 years after the events of Ghost of Tsushima in 1603, the new title will see a fresh protagonist taking the spotlight as we set out to explore a brand new region of Japan. Thanks to a recent trailer, we now know that the game is launching in early October and that it will be a PS5 exclusive – sorry to all you PC players!
Digimon Story Time Stranger
Developer: Media. Vision Inc.
Publisher: Bandai Namco
Release date: October 3, 2025
If you're getting restless waiting for a new Pokemon game from Nintendo, then Digimon Story Time Stranger is here to help. The upcoming PS5 game is the latest entry in the classic monster-taming series and will throw you into a story that spans the human world and the Digital World. You'll have to engage in turn-based combat and complete quests to uncover the mysteries of the world's collapse here. While we don't have a solid release date for Digimon Story Time Stranger just yet, we do know that it will be heading our way sometime this year.
Battlefield 6
Developer: Battlefield Studios
Publisher: EA
Release date: October 10, 2025
It's been years of waiting, but we are getting the official follow-up to Battlefield 5 later this year! That means if you are a fan of the best FPS games, your time has come. We recently got a Battlefield 6 release date that confirms the previous leaks online, suggesting that it could be launching on October 10. That means it's only weeks away, folks!
Little Nightmares 3
Developer: Supermassive Games
Publisher: Bandai Namco
Release date: October 10, 2025
Little Nightmares 3 is heading our way just in time for the spooky season! Set to release on October 10, this creepy co-op adventure has you and your player-two take on the role of two small children (Low and Alone) as they must platform and puzzle-solve their way out of the nightmarish realm known as The Nowhere. However, much like the previous games in the series, you won't be able to try and explore at your own leisure. There are plenty of threats and monsters who are more than happy to chase you. Be prepared to think and react quickly!
Ninja Gaiden 4
Developer: PlatinumGames Inc. / Team NINJA
Publisher: Xbox Game Studios
Release date: October 21, 2025
As part of more Xbox games making their way to the PS5, Ninja Gaiden 4 has been announced and will be heading our way in October this year. If you are unfamiliar with the Ninja Gaiden series, these are the games to play if you are after a ninja hack-and-slash experience, and it's been years since we last saw a new game from the universe. In Ninja Gaiden 4, you'll get to play both the legendary Ryu Hayabusa and the new protagonist Yakumo. From what we've seen, the upcoming PS5 game looks bonkers in the best possible way, with tons of environments and enemies to encounter. We may just have one of the best action games of 2025 here, folks!
Jurassic World Evolution 3
Developer: Frontier Developments
Publisher: Frontier Developments
Release date: October 21, 2025
Life, uh, found a way – at least, found a way to allow you to finally add a litter of dino babies to your park in this latest iteration of the charming-yet-deadly park manager that puts us into the mind of the Hammond-like figures who mucked everything all up thinking 'well maybe it will work for us'. And for the most part, it does! All manner of dinos are available, and yes, unique features can be carried over from generation to generation. Favorite characters also return, including Doctor Ian Malcolm (still portrayed by Jeff Goldblum). Enhancements abound as well, revolving around making dinos act more naturally in their habitats. Honesty, Jurassic World Evolution 3 looks like a hoot!
Once Upon a KATAMARI
Developer: RENGAME
Publisher: Bandai Namco
Release date: October 23, 2025
Once Upon a KATAMARI was officially revealed during a recent Nintendo Direct livestream and was also confirmed to be an upcoming PS5 game, much to all our collective glee. This is honestly one of the most anticipated games of October on my personal list. Roll your planet ball through different periods of history, collecting and expanding your rolling sphere with every artefact collected. There's a new soundtrack, four player co-op, and some shiny new customization options too. Basically, it's a winner all around and I'll be unreachable for a few days once it comes out.
The Outer Worlds 2
Developer: Obsidian Entertainment
Publisher: Xbox Game Studios
Release date: October 29, 2025
The Outer Worlds 2 is set to bring us to Arcadia where we can expect fresh adventures with in a new colony that's said to be home of "skip drive technology." With a debut trailer showing off the same signature sense of humor from the first game, the upcoming sci-fi adventure will once again let us shape our own journey and character, and engage with a new cast of companions who all have their dreams to fulfil - whether or not you want to help them is up to you.
Arc Raiders
Developer: Embark Studios
Publisher: Embark Studios
Release date: October 30, 2025
It's been years coming, but Arc Raiders finally has a release date – October 30 – to look forward to. The extraction shooter recently opened its doors for a second test, and has been steadily building momentum since – because, spoiler alert, it seems really good. Arc Raiders is currently the eighth most wishlisted game on Steam, and with just a few months to go until its long-awaited PS5 launch, it really does feel like if anything can crack the highly competitive shooter genre, it's going to be Embark Studios.
Mina The Hollower
Developer: Yacht Club Games
Publisher: Yacht Club Games
Release date: October 31, 2025
The developer of Shovel Knight returns with this upcoming PS game, and once again, they can't resist striking the earth! Yet what Shovel Knight did for 2D side-on platformers, Mina the Hollower, centering on a whip-wielding rodent, does for top-down Game Boy-style adventures like The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening. Playing with conventions, the gameplay changes up now and then to have some more action-heavy set-pieces. But for the most part, Mina will be questing whip in hand through dungeon environments. The big twist, of course, is her abilities as Hollower – she can burrow into the ground to pop up elsewhere!
Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2
Developer: The Chinese Room
Publisher: Paradox Interactive
Release date: October 2025
Looking for a game with a bit of extra bite? Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 puts you in the seedy underbelly of Seattle, which should suit you just fine as a vampire ready to test out your new fangs. Turned as an act of vampire terrorism during the 'Mass Embrace', you'll soon get caught up in vampire faction politics, where you're still just trying to deal with your new way of life. This is an RPG at its core, too, filled with player choices, a strong narrative, and branching dialogue options.
Cairn
Developer: The Game Bakers
Publisher: The Game Bakers
Release date: November 5, 2025
Speaking of high, climbing adventure, Cairn finally has a release date of November 5. This has been one to watch since The Game Bakers – the developer behind Furi – revealed it last year. When we last caught up with the studio in January, Cairn was described as "our most challenging production in terms of development complexity," – and if you've got an issue with heights, it might be just as tough to play.
Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road
Developer: LEVEL5 Inc.
Publisher: LEVEL5 Inc.
Release date: November 13, 2025
Although this upcoming RPG and sports game was initially scheduled to be with us in August, we're still super excited to get our hands on this one despite the delays. Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road is LEVEL5 Inc.'s next entry to the famed football RPG that will have you taking on the role of a high school student named Destin Billows. Play matches while you also work through a story that looks right of an anime. From trailers, the game looks amazing and seems like it'll make you feel like the star in your very own shonen series.
Octopath Traveler 0

Publisher: Square Enix
Release date: December 4, 2025
Fans of JRPGs rejoice because we are getting a Octopath Traveler prequel at the end of the year. Octopath Traveler 0 is an upcoming PS5 game that's set years before the first game in the series and will have you playing as your own customizable character instead of a premade one seen in the franchises previous outings. You can choose to recruit a party from a pool of 30 characters and must work to rebuild your home village. The Octopath Traveler 0 looks very charming but we are still waiting for more gameplay details on this one.

Publisher: TeamKill Media LLC

If you love keeping track of upcoming horror games, then the PS5 exclusive Code Violet has to be on your radar. Marathon

Publisher: SIE
Release date: TBC 2025
A classic shooter is getting more than a fresh lick of paint in Bungie's high-octane remake of Marathon. The announcement trailer seen during the PlayStation Showcase 2023 is peppered with nods to the arcade stylings of the 1994 original, this time in sleek, hyper-pigmented 4K graphics to introduce Marathon to a new generation. And with more gameplay shown since, it's good to see Bungie giving some love to other IPs aside from Destiny 2 and Halo.
Mixtape

Publisher: Annapurna Interactive
Release date: TBC 2025

It's due out later in 2025, and even without a firm release date, I'm already getting a little bit teary eyed thinking about Annapurna's latest.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7

Publisher: Activision

2026

The next game from Road 96 developer DigixArt, Tides of Tomorrow, is a choose-your-own-adventure-style adventure with a twist. Rather than leaving players to deal with their own decisions (see: terrible mistakes), Tides of Tomorrow syncs you up with other players – be they pals or streamers – and changes your story based on who you choose to follow. It's an interesting premise, so anyone looking for something genuinely fresh in the multiplayer scene should keep an eye out for more on this.
GTA 6
Developer: In-hoise
Publisher: Rockstar Games
Release date: May 26, 2026

Clear your schedules, because GTA 6 is going to be the biggest new game of 2025.
TBC 2026
Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection

Publisher: Capcom
Release date: TBC 2026
Following the massive success of Monster Hunter Wilds in early 2025, we are now also getting the next entry in the Monster Hunter Stories series sometime in 2026. You play as an heir and must explore the world, tame monsters and eliminate all the threats that stand before you.
The Adventures of Elliot: The Millennium Tales
Developer: Team Asano
Publisher: Square Enix
Release date: TBC 2026

The combat looks very fun from what we've seen from the trailer already, so we have high hopes that this will be a 2026 standout.

Publisher: Supermassive Games
Release date: TBC 2026

In this new PS5 game, a crew wakes up from Stasis unexpectedly, only to find that their ship has been invaded by a dangerous alien that can mimic its prey. Like all other Supermassive Games experiences, the main objective is survival here, and we can't wait to see more of the title's gameplay. Originally, the game was set to release in October 2025; however, it's now been pushed to 2026. We're still waiting on a new release date, so keep your eyes peeled on this page!
The Blood of Dawnwalker

Publisher: Bandai Namco Entertainment
Release date: TBC 2026
Developed by Rebel Wolves, a new studio founded by The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt director Konrad Tomaszkiewicz, The Blood of Dawnwalker is a goth gamer's dream. So far, we've only seen a cinematic trailer and a small glimpse of gameplay for this title, but everything looks fantastic so far. Fingers crossed that we have a new hit on our hands!
Planet of Lana 2: Children of the Leaf
Developer: Wishfully
Publisher: Thunderful Publishing
Release date: TBC 2026

From venturing through ruins to solving puzzles, and much more, the sequel promises to more challenges and a longer, deeper story.
Mortal Shell 2
Developer: Cold Symmetry
Publisher: Playstack
Release date: TBC 2026
The first Mortal Shell was pretty gnarly and goopy, a unique take on the soulslike genre that was all about butting heads with strange foes by using equally as strange powers – including hardening – switching powers to match the threat. Mortal Shell 2 dares to ask: what if things were even more metal? And there were guns? With an introductory metal song by Ben Sahar, performed by Behemoth, this is like they injected Doom straight into the original game, all flames and fury as you tear about the oddest beasts you could imagine.
Beast of Reincarnation

Publisher: Fictions
Release date: TBC 2026

You must pursue the titular beast, which seems to be causing nature to run rampant in ways that are somewhat destructive. The game was revealed during the Xbox Games Showcase at Summer Game Fest 2025 and looks visually breathtaking. With clashing blades, a wolf companion, and a stunning world to explore, there's a lot to look forward to here.

This direct sequel from Bandai Namco dials things up by adding timey elements to the mix, and even more over-the-top powers. Crunchy, weighty attacks that see your main characters transform mid-combat seem to be taking cues from the Scarlet Nexus – their more recent release – so we can expect Code Vein 2 to embrace quicker, more combo-heavy brawls while evolving the unique tone of the original.

The story is a little hazy at this stage aside from featuring a lot of bullets, gore, and deep space horror, but judging from the reveal trailer, this will be one for the classic survival horror fans to dig their teeth into.

It's up to you to use this strange object to defeat monsters from another world called Genma. The cation will be set in Edo-era Kyoto and promises to sport plenty of dark fantasy elements. Embark on expeditions, discover vibrant worlds and their features, face dangerous creatures, and see how your ever-evolving space station changes with each upgrade. MARVEL 1943: Rise of Hydra

Ubisoft Montreal – the birthplace of Assassin's Creed – is working on a very different type of entry to the series. Following the release of Assassin's Creed Valhalla in 2020, the studio has been quietly working on Assassin's Creed Codename Hexe under the leadership of Watch Dogs Legion's creative director Clint Hocking. While it's thought to be in early development, an early tease suggests a far darker setting that could revolve around Europe's bloody 16th century witch trials. Sadly, there's a good chance we'll be waiting until 2025 and beyond for this one.
Cities Skylines 2
Developer: Colossal Order
Publisher: Paradox
Release date: TBC
Cities Skylines 2 is finally coming to console after its PC launch last year, and is the long-awaited sequel to one of the most popular city builders of all time. It's bringing with it enhanced features like better road tools, public and cargo transportation, traffic AI, massive 150 tile maps per unique city, and a cinematic camera. We'll also be able to get much closer to the action than ever before, with the opportunity to follow individual citizens from birth to death in your city.
Dune Awakening
Developer: Funcom
Publisher: Funcom
Release date: TBC (PC release June 10, 2025)
Funcom is bringing us a new survival open-world MMO set in the vast landscape of the classic sci-fi setting Arrakis. Dune: Awakening is said to blend the survival game genre with a multiplayer experience as you try to live in the harsh landscapes of the planet. You'll be building shelters to weather sandstorms, looking after your stillsuit, and trying to brave the deep desertland. It'll be interesting to see how the famous setting serves as a home for an MMO experience. During Gamescom 2024, it was announced that the game is set to release in Early Access for PC players in 2025. However, we are still waiting on a PS5 release window.
Elder Scrolls 6
Developer: Bethesda Game Studios
Publisher: Bethesda
Release date: TBC
Ah, the Elder Scrolls 6. The 37-second trailer that blew the world's mind at E3 2018. The game that we know nothing about beyond this same trailer, that is in development somewhere within Bethesda Game Studios along with Starfield. Because it is so far away from release, you can bet your bottom coin that it's going to appear - at some point - on the PS5 (although hopefully not whatever the PS6 could be).
Fairgames
Developer: Haven Studios
Publisher: SIE
Release date: TBC
Haven Studios was acquired by Sony Interactive Entertainment in 2022, becoming part of the PlayStation Studios family to help lead the PS5's expanding live service initiative. The studio's debut is Fairgames, an all-new co-op experience where you'll team up with friends to go up against the corporate overloads squeezing the life out of the world. A report surfaced in 2025 that studio lead Jade Raymond had parted ways with the project, and we're still awaiting a further update on the new multiplayer experience.
Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet
Developer: Naughty Dog
Publisher: SIE
Release date: TBC
Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet is the new game from Last of Us and Uncharted developer Naughty Dog. Currently in development for PS5, the project has been in the works since 2020 and will see us take on the role of new protagonist Jordan A. Mun, a bounty hunter who ends up stranded on a distant planet that's said to have lost communication with the outside universe hundreds of years ago.
Light No Fire
Developer: Hello Games
Publisher: Hello Games
Release date: TBC
No Man's Sky developer Hello Games is bringing us a new experience with Light No Fire - a survival sandbox adventure you can play with others. Set on an open-world fantasy planet that's described as being the same size as the Earth, you'll be given the freedom to explore its diverse biomes as you try to unravel its lore and mysteries. With building and survival aspects, we also saw in the reveal trailer that you can fly through the vistas on the back of a dragon, climb mountains, and even set sail across the oceans.
Marvel's Wolverine
Developer: Insomniac
Publisher: Sony Interactive Entertainment
Release date: TBC
Undoubtedly one of the biggest surprises of the PlayStation September 2021 showcase came in the shape of those famous adamantium claws belonging to none other than Wolverine. Yes, a new standalone Marvel's Wolverine game is currently in development. While we're light on details for the moment, we do know Brian Horton is Wolverine's creative director, and Cameron Christian is the game director. Horton was creative director on Spider-Man Miles Morales and has also worked on games such as Tomb Raider and Rise of the Tomb Raider.
New Mass Effect
Developer: BioWare
Publisher: EA
Release date: TBC
It might be quite a way off release, but that isn't going to stop us being ridiculously overexcited for a brand new Mass Effect game - aka Mass Effect 5. Seemingly picking up after the events of Mass Effect 3, we'll be seeing some old faces return and some plot lines picked back up. Of course, the big question of whether Shepard will return remains, but we're ready for everything.
New Virtua Fighter Project
Developer: Rya Ga Gotoku Studio
Publisher: Sega
Release date: TBC
Very little is known about the new Virtua Fighter Project currently in the works, but the the brief teaser trailer showed off a powerful figure in a hat who punched another man through a wall. Said to be a completely new project in the Virtua Fighter series, it's certainly one to watch out for.
Okami sequel
Developer: Capcom
Publisher: Capcom
Release date: TBC
A sequel to the beloved painterly adventure Okami is currently in the works from Capcom and game director Hideki Kamiya. With a brief teaser trailer show so far, we've only gotten of glimpse of the follow-up so far, but it looks set to bring us to another gorgeous world in the same signature style, with the promise of a heartwarming story in the same vein as the original as we once again take on the role of Amaterasu.
Phantom Blade 0
Developer: Cruel Man Studio
Publisher: S-Game
Release date: TBC
If you're a fan of samurai swashbuckling and moody feudal Japan as a setting, Phantom Blade 0 seems to be promising us both. The third person action title is yet to have a confirmed release date, but from what we've seen at the PlayStation Showcase 2023, your character has "66 days to live". What will he do with it? "Get my heart back," he responds. We don't know much else just yet, but its brooding color scheme and fast-paced melee combat seem like a dynamic blend of Gungrave GORE aesthetics with Ghost of Tsushima action, and we're already here for it.
Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic Remake
Developer: Aspyr
Publisher: Sony Interactive Entertainment and Lucasfilms Games
Release date: TBC
After many rumors began circulating, the latest Sony showcase confirmed that a remaster of BioWare's beloved Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic is on the way, and the upcoming Star Wars game is coming to PS5. Aspyr and Sony Interactive Entertainment are working with Lucasfilm Games to rebuild the classic adventure, which promises to bring KOTOR to a new generation with "modern tech, features, visuals, and more, while maintaining the integrity of the story and characters" so many have come to love.
Thick as Thieves
Developer: OtherSide Entertainment
Publisher: Megabit Publishing
Release date: TBC
What happens when several thieves, each with their own special set of talents gets put on the same heist. Well, you can find out the answer to that question with the upcoming PvPvE game, Thick as Thieves. Outwit and act fast to steal treasure before any other players can get their hands on it. However, be warned, it isn't easy rising through the ranks in a 1910s metropolis that is filled with shadows and magic. Thick as Thieves looks to be tons of fun and an exciting spin to typical stealth based gameplay. Currently, we're still waiting for a release date for it, so stay tuned for updates.
Lumines Arise
Developer: Enhance, Monstars
Publisher: TBC
Release date: TBC
Where do you go from a game as sublime as Tetris Effect? Switch gears, and apply the same Enhance transcendental puzzling action to another franchise entirely with Lumines Arise. Promising to take us away to yet another synesthetic sensory wonderland, reviving the PSP classic Lumines: Puzzle Fusion from Q Entertainment. Like Tetris, it's all about falling blocks, except here you have to nudge them into 2x2 grids and match colors to get them to pop. The must-have portable puzzler drew comparisons to Tetris with its original release, so it's the perfect successor for the Tetris Effect developers to have some more fun.
ILL
Developer: Team Cloud
Publisher: Mundfish Powerhouse
Release date: TBC
Perhaps the gnarliest game of Summer Game Fest 2025, Ill has resurfaced after several years of cooking from developer Team Cloud. It comes with good news for horror fans: it looks gnarlier than ever, with its creature design leaning into body horror with zombified babies and – for lack of a better term – inside-out people. There was also a huge emphasis on reactivity to gunshots – shoot a humanoid in the leg, and it stumbles down for an execution. This has been on indie horror fans' radars for years, but fingers crossed it's inching toward a release date now that it's under the wing of Atomic Heart developer Mundfish's new creative label.
For more future releases coming to other platforms, head over to our lists for all the upcoming PC games, upcoming Switch 2 games, and upcoming Switch games.

Upcoming PC games: New PC games for 2025 and beyond
All the latest upcoming PC games on the way this year and next, from Octopath Traveler 0 to Borderlands 4
It's August, and thanks to these upcoming PC games, the last weeks of Summer are set to be thrilling ones. It's been a jam-packed 2025 already, with Grounded 2, Killing Floor 3, and Tales of the Shire having launched in the last month alone.
If you're like me, though, there's no such thing as too many new games, which is where this list comes in. This list compiles all of the new PC games still to come this year, from some seriously gnarly upcoming horror games (including Dying Light: The Beast, which was recently delayed to September), to some very important upcoming RPGs. We even have a remaster of the original Gears of War to keep an eye out for in the coming weeks, as well as a new Kirby adventure, the long-awaited Mafia prequel, and a host of gorgeous upcoming indie games to choose from. Octopath Traveler 0 is also on the way, following a stunning reveal at July's Nintendo Direct, meaning fans of the best JRPGs are in for a truly magical winter. We also got a first glimpse at Once Upon a Katamari, too, which is scheduled to launch in just a few short weeks.
With everything in release date order, you'll have a Steam wishlist crammed with upcoming PC games in no time. Ready to dive in? Let's start with this month's offerings...
All the new PC games to keep an eye on
2025
Mafia: The Old Country
Developer: Hangar 13
Release date: August 8, 2025
The Mafia games are iconic, so of course we're excited that a new title in the series is coming to PC in 2025. Mafia: The Old Country is a prequel that will take players to the streets of 1900s Sicily. You'll take on the role of Enzo Favara and will have to prove your worth as you try to navigate (and survive) the underworld of one of the most unforgiving periods of criminal history.
Sword of the Sea
Developer: Giant Squid
Release date: August 19, 2025
You'd be forgiven if you thought this was Journey 2. It's close, and made by some of the same people. Sword of the Sea is brought to you by Giant Squid, which has delivered Abzu and The Pathless to date, and it sees you playing as a character called Wraith. You'll be zooming around an abandoned realm on a Hoversword (yes you read that right), exploring the Necropolis of the Gods, but also trying to avoid the leviathans that dwell there. It looks exceptionally beautiful and zen, and we can't wait to see more.
Weekly digests, tales from the communities you love, and more
Gears of War: Reloaded
Developer: The Coalition
Release date: August 26, 2025
Gears of War: Reloaded is a full remaster of the first game, so you'll be able to dive into the action that kickstarted the iconic Xbox series from The Coalition on PC with lots of shiny bells and whistles, including 4K resolution and 120 FPS support, along with online and split-screen co-op in the campaign, and cross-play for its returning multiplayer experience.
Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater
Developer: Konami
Release date: August 28, 2025
Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater is the long-awaited remake of Metal Gear Solid 3. According to the developer, it's going to be a faithful story recreation but offer players evolved gameplay and visuals. While it's a pretty faithful portrayal of some of those original environments, too, you can expect some new features, including an original online multiplayer mode to get stuck into.
Hell is Us
Developer: Rogue Factor
Release date: September 4, 2025
The Hell is Us trailer is wild, and it immediately caught our attention as soon as we saw it. In a world that was gripped and ruined by a mysterious calamity, you must explore what’s left and face some of the wackiest-looking creatures while doing so. The semi-open world is combat-heavy, strange, and comes with no maps or compass markers, meaning that it'll be easy to get lost as well as discover wonders unexpectedly. So far, the game looks to be a surreal trip that we're personally all for taking come September time.
Borderlands 4
Developer: Gearbox Software
Release date: September 12, 2025
After years of waiting, we finally have news that Borderlands 4 will be heading our way in September 2025, and it got moved ahead by a whole week because the devs are so confident that we'll love it. That's right, more looter shooter action is coming. This time, though, we won't be traveling around Pandora. It's been confirmed that there will be a new alien planet for us to explore in the upcoming PC game, so if you were expecting a repeat of the best Borderlands games, this is going to be a fresh experience.
Dying Light: The Beast
Developer: Techland
Release date: September 19, 2025
The next Dying Light game is set to bring back Kyle Crane in all his glory, this time with surprising new powers. The Beast is one upcoming PC game I can't wait to check out this summer, a bloody hack-n-slash zombie-busting fest that is promising everything developer Techland does best: action, horror, gore, and more, this time with vehicles and firearms making a long-awaited return following Dying Light's The Following DLC from 2016. What's not to love? See you in Castor Woods soon...
Silent Hill f
Developer: NeoBards Entertainment Ltd.
Release date: September 25, 2025
Silent Hill f is the next big installment in Konami's iconic series and we can't wait! Not only is this the first Silent Hill game not set in the US (taking us to 1960s Japan instead), and from its trailers, it looks horrifically stunning. You'll get the chance to play as the highschooler Hinako, whose ordinary life is turned upside down once a mysterious fog engulfs and starts changing her hometown into a literal nightmare. Silent Hill f will come our way in September.
Digimon Story Time Stranger
Developer: Media. Vision Inc.
Release date: October 2, 2025
Who needs Pokémon when we have a new Digimon game to look forward to this year? Sorry, Nintendo, but our monster-taming sights are firmly set on the upcoming PC game Digimon Story Time Stranger for now. In the upcoming JRPG, you'll have to discover the mysteries surrounding the collapse of your world, kickstarting an adventure that will send you across parallel dimensions and into different realities.
Little Nightmares 3
Developer: Supermassive Games
Release date: October 10, 2025
Bandai Namco's unnerving horror-platformer series is back. We heard from Little Nightmares 3 developer Supermassive Games at Gamescom 2023, where they told us all about what it's like to spearhead the third instalment. We know the first chapter takes us through the arid plains of Necropolis, with the horrifying Monster Baby chasing down our two new protagonists, Low and Alone. LN3 will also be the first in the series to go the multiplayer route, with it being an optional game mode if you want to play the game with a friend via local couch co-op.
Little Nightmares Enhanced Edition
Developer: Engine Software BV
Release date: October 10, 2025
Alongside Little Nightmares 3, the game that started it all is getting a shiny re-release with Little Nightmares Enhanced Edition. Set to support 4K and 60FPS, you step into unsettling world of the Maw as Six for the first time, or rediscover it all again complete with Performance and Quality modes, improved visuals, and gameplay tweaks including game helpers and updated checkpoints.
Keeper
Developer: Double Fine Productions
Release date: October 17, 2025
Keeper is described as a surreal third-person atmospheric adventure filled with a puzzles. Telling a tale without using words, you follow the story of a forgotten lighthouse who stands alone on a island lost at sea. When the lighthouse awakens and tendrils start to snake out of its once dormant form, you control the vertical structure as it sets with a mysterious purpose. Joined by a seabird, you'll make your way to center of the island.
Jurassic World Evolution 3
Developer: Frontier Developments
Release date: October 21, 2025
Everyone knows that management games run best on PC, so no doubt a ton of players will be thrilled to hear that we are getting a new Jurassic World Evolution game, with Jurassic World Evolution 3. It's up to you to make the best (and probably most daily) tourist attraction around as you unlock dinosaurs and attract guests to your prehistoric park. A ton of dinos are up for grabs here, including cute baby ones, and favorite characters also return, including Doctor Ian Malcolm (still portrayed by Jeff Goldblum).
Ninja Gaiden 4
Developers: PlatinumGames Inc. / Team NINJA
Release date: October 21, 2025
Grab your masks and get ready to hide in the shadows because Ninja Gaiden 4 has been announced and will be heading our way in October. If you are unfamiliar with the Ninja Gaiden series, these are the games to play if you are after a ninja hack-and-slash experience. The series is iconic, and now the story is being expanded to usher in a new generation. In Ninja Gaiden 4, you'll get to play both the legendary Ryu Hayabusa and the new protagonist Yakumo. From what we've seen so far, the action looks incredible. Now, we just need to wait for Fall to roll around!
Once Upon a Katamari
Developer: Bandai Namco
Release date: October 23, 2025
Ever wanted to be a giant sticky ball rolling about the cosmos? Wait, you've done that already?! Well, Once Upon a Katamari is promising a brand new serving of the classic snowball-style action game, and it's coming out just days away from Halloween. The latest chapter will see us venturing "through new worlds to roll up thy heart's desires," restoring the stars at the behest of our sassy, stocking-clad father. I'm just as confused as you are, but it's hard not to crack a smile at an upcoming PC game with this much whimsy.
The Outer Worlds 2
Developer: Obsidian Entertainment
Release date: October 29, 2025
The Outer Worlds 2 is bringing us to Arcadia for new adventures with a fresh colony that's said to have "skip drive" technology. Promising to carry on the first entry's signature sense of humor, Obsidian's follow-up will introduce a new cast of companions with their own dreams to fulfill - and we can choose whether or not we help them. Taking on the role of an "Earth Directorate" agent, we'll investigate dangerous rifts and be presented with choices that will let us shape our own sci-fi-shaped journey.
Arc Raiders
Developer: Embark Studios
Release date: October 30, 2025
Arc Raiders is a new multiplayer extraction adventure that sees you take on the role of a raider in a desolate world. As you scavenge for supplies in dangerous environments, you'll try to build yourself a home underground and try to survive against deadly machines that roam the surface. As you go about completing quests, you can also get to know local traders and work towards upgrades.
Mina The Hollower
Developer: Yacht Club Games
Release date: October 31, 2025
From the developer of Shovel Knight comes another hit heading to PC. Mina The Hollower is a top-down Game Boy-style kind of adventure that gives off strong The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening. From what we've seen so far from the game, it's stylish, fast-paced, and oozes with charm. For sure, one to add to your wishlists, especially if you are a fan of action-heavy titles with an adorable twist.
Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2
Developer: The Chinese Room
Release date: October 2025
It's been two decades since the first game, but Vampire The Masquerade: Bloodlines 2 is intended to launch in late 2025. The much-anticipated sequel to a cult classic RPG, Bloodlines 2, has emerged from a rocky developmental period with tons to show for it, including post-alpha gameplay, four playable vampire clans upon release, and plenty of planned DLC to boot. Bloodlines 2 is a "neo-noir thriller" that will see us step into the shoes of customizable main character Phyre, a recently re-awoken Elder vampire who finds themselves in the middle of a very different Boston Camarilla than they remember. As a powerful child of the night grappling with the newness of the modern world, this might just be the vampire RPG experience we've been waiting for since Troika Games' original.
Cairn
Developer: The Game Bakers
Release date: November 5, 2025
Cairn is a new realistic climbing simulation that sees you take on the role of a pro climber called Aava. As you set out to make your way up Mount Kami, the summit of which has never been reached, you'll meet other climbers and solve problems along the way as you freely explore the mountain, journey over the rock face, and navigate your way through difficult sections.
Octopath Traveler 0
Developer: Square Enix
Release date: December 4, 2025
Turn-based JRPG fans, you're in luck. Octopath Traveler 0 is officially coming this December, set to deliver a prequel to the last two games that expands its already iconic formula. You'll be in control of an eight-character party, selected from a pool of "over 30 recruitable members" as you embark upon yet another stunning medieval fantasy journey. This is one upcoming PC game we are very happy to count among the year's roster, and despite the series' popularity as some of the best Switch games ever, it's sure to be a heavy-hitter for PC players too.
TBC 2025
Marathon
Developer: Bungie
Release date: TBC 2025
Marathon is the revival of Bungie's shooter that was in development before Destiny. It's an extraction shooter, we guess in the vein of Escape from Tarkhov or Rainbow Six Extraction. We're already loving the art style, and with Bungie's shooting at the heart, this one is going to be one to pay attention to. It's since been pushed out of its September release date, and we're still awaiting word on when it will arrive.
Mixtape
Developer: Beethoven and Dinosaur
Release date: TBC 2025
It's been years of waiting, but we finally know that Mixtape from Artful Escape developer, Beethoven and Dinosaur will be heading to PC later this year in 2025. Inspired by classic teen movies and coming-of-age stories, this new PC game is set against a backdrop of endless, lazy summers. While not much around the characters and story is known yet, we have seen clips of mall skateboarding antics, roadtrips and fireside circles. It looks like a total vibe, and we can't wait to learn more!
Hollow Knight: Silksong
Developer: Team Cherry
Release date: TBC 2025
Team Cherry started out by developing DLC for Hollow Knight, one of the best Metroidvania games of the modern era, and the scope of the project quickly spiraled out of control. Now a full fledge sequel that's been years in the making, Hollow Knight: Silksong will feature all-new combat mechanics, characters, and worlds to learn and explore, and despite all these years of waiting, we're still excited to jump back in. Never fear, if there's more concrete release date news, we'll be updating as soon as we can.
Slay the Spire 2
Developer: Mega Crit
Release date: TBC 2025
As the sequel to the stellar 2019 roguelike deck-builder, Slay the Spire 2 from developer Mega Crit will see you head into a newly evolved spire where dangerous, deadly foes lurk within its labyrinth. With fresh cards to strategize with, along with relics and potions that offer up game-changing effects, you'll climb your way up to the top and face ever-changing challenges and layouts each time you attempt to reach new heights.
Metal Eden
Developer: Reikon Games
Release date: TBC 2025
If you love playing all the top FPS games that Steam has to offer, then you'll want to pay attention to this new PC game. Metal Edan follows a Hyper Unit Aska, who are sent on a suicide mission to try and save their citizens. However, when they venture onto Moebius, an orbital city, they are met with carnage. From clips and trailers for this upcoming title, we've seen plenty of bright colors, cybernetic warfare, and fast gameplay on display. It looks like a wild, fun time and should be on your radar if you love blasting robots with guns.
Witchbrook
Developer: Chucklefish / Robotality
Release date: TBC 2025
Witchbrook is new magic school life sim from Wargoove and Eastward publisher Chucklefish that's set to bring us to the cozy seaside city of Mossport. In a delightful pixelated art style, you'll be able to enroll in Witchbrook college and take lessons to master the magical arts. With residents to get to know (and even develop romantic relationships with if you so choose), you can also spend your time growing your own garden, decorating your cottage, go shopping, hit the arcade, and more. Complete with four-player online co-op support, this is one adventure that promises to cast a spell over us.
Clockwork Revolution
Developer: inXile
Release date: TBC 2025
One of the coolest-looking upcoming PC games is Clockwork Revolution, a steampunk action adventure that resembles BioShock Infinite. There's no official release date just yet, but what we saw at the 2023 Xbox Games Showcase gives us reason to get excited. Right now it's expected to launch sometime in 2025 or later, so watch this space...
Crimson Desert
Developer: Pearl Abyss
Release date: TBC 2025
If gritty third-person action is your vibe, you'll love Crimson Desert. This upcoming PC game sees players traversing unforgiving lands as Kliff Macduff, a lone warrior who deals with problems (and monsters) by the sword. You only need to check out our Crimson Desert preview to see how much this open-world has to offer, from combo-based combat encounters to a sprawling world to explore and conquer.
Tears of Metal
Developer: Paper Cult
Release date: TBC 2025
Tears of Metal screams “Freedom” as its clans descend on the battlefield in a roguelike co-op hack n slash. The almost comic-book art style hides brutal skirmishes between legions of medieval Scottish fighters, but there’s a common enemy afoot. A fiery meteor has crashed into a distant island, and our battalions are facing an oncoming invasion like no other. It’s not all stabby stabby, though, the trailer gave us a first look at some interesting management and strategy mechanics that will serve each run as well. Tears of Metal is due to land in 2025 on Steam.
2026
Resident Evil Requiem
Developer: Capcom
Release date: February 27, 2026
We didn't think it would be real, but our dreams have all collectively come true because Resident Evil 9 (aka Resident Evil Requiem) was announced during the Summer Game Fest 2025 Live presentation. Come February 2026, we'll be diving back into Raccoon City, following FBI agent Grace Ashcroft, whose past is tied heavily to the Remnant Hotel – perhaps a little too heavily. There's plenty of intrigue and anticipation with this one, so our hopes are high for Capcom's latest addition to one of the best horror franchises ever made.
TBC 2026
Directive 8020
Developer: Supermassive Games
Release date: TBC 2026
What better way to celebrate a new year than with a new scary interactive story? That's right, Until Dawn and The Dark Pictures Anthology developer Supermassive Games has another horror game in the works. This time, we'll be flung into a sci-fi spooky take with a story reminiscent of some of the best horror movies like The Thing and Alien. In this new PC game, a crew wakes up from stasis unexpectedly, only to find that their ship has been invaded by an alien who can mimic its prey (where is Kurt Russel when you need him, right?). Like all other Supermassive Games experiences, the main objective is survival here. Originally, this was a 2025 title, but it has been delayed to 2026.
The Blood of Dawnwalker
Developer: Rebel Wolves
Release date: TBC 2026
The Blood of Dawnwalker is an exciting new RPG from newly formed studio Rebel Wolves - which is made of former The Witcher devs. Set in 14th-century Europe, which is rife with plague and conflict, you take on the role of Coen, a half-human, half-vampire, who sets out to try and save his family. Whether you embrace your vampiric powers or your humanity is up to you as you face various foes. Said to be the start of a new saga, this looks set to be one new RPG to watch out for.
Chronicles Medieval
Developer: Raw Power Games
Release date: TBC 2026
The debut game from Raw Power Games, Chronicles: Medieval looks like the first game to truly bring competition to Mount and Blade's specific blend of strategy and action. A brutal war game set in medieval Europe, Chronicles: Medieval was revealed with a trailer narrated by Tom Hardy that was mostly CG, but still managed to squeeze in a shot of the player gathering together a band of troops. It's the sort of blend of big-picture strategy and moment-to-moment action that's kept PC players hooked on Total War for years – albeit with much more direct stabbing – so this one's going right on the Steam wishlist.
Blighted
Developer: Drinkbox Studios
Release date: TBC 2026
Metroidvania get ready because Silksong isn't the only title heading to PC. However, this offering is only heading our way in 2026. Blighted is a "psychedelic western nightmare" from Drinkbox Studios that takes place in a sort of isometric perspective (think Hades). You'll get the chance to experience a colourful adventure either solo or with up to three friends. From the clips we've seen, the art is stunning, and the co-op action looks to be especially engaging.
Out of Words
Developer: WiredFly, Kong Orange
Release date: TBC 2026
Out of Words is a new co-op adventure that you can play with a pal online with cross-platform support, or locally in couch co-op. Taking on the role of either Kurt or Karla, you'll venture through a world entirely made by hand with a distinct puppet-like style, where you'll have to work together to save the wonderland you're in.
Mortal Shell 2
Developer: Cold Symmetry
Release date: TBC 2026
Mortal Shell 2 is a standalone sequel to the 2021 game that will bring us more soulslike action RPG goodness in 2026. Set in an interconnected open-world that expands on the original experience, you can expect high-stakes battles, a more in-depth combat system with various skills and abilities, and more exploration.
Infinitesimals

Release date: TBC 2026
Set to come to PC on the Epic Game store, Infinitesimals sees you take on the role of the leader of an alien squadron who lands on a mysterious planet and gets stranded. As the size of an insect in this place, the world towers over you, and you'll have to navigate is massive dangers as you search for your team.
Code Vein 2

End of Abyss
Developer: Section 9 Interactive
Release date: TBC 2026
Taking on the role of a combat technician called Cal, End of Abyss is a dark new action-adventure that will see you delve down into the depths of an underground compound. As you explore derelict areas to investigate mysterious disturbances, you'll face strange creatures that aren't human. Along the way, you'll have to improve your gear and just try to stay alive in facility you'll soon find yourself trapped in.
Game of Thrones: War for Westeros
Developer: PlaySide
Release date: TBC 2026
Were you annoyed with the ending of the Game of Thrones TV show, and can't wait for George RR Martin to finally finish Winds of Winter (not that we're doubting)? Game of Thrones: War for Westeros puts the power in your hands to decide what happens after winter finally comes, this RTS Strategy asking you to play strategist – "you decide who lives, and who dies". This is teased in the reveal trailer by showing a clash between Jon Snow and the White Walkers' Night King, having Jon win at first, then showing a version where it's reversed.
Fable 4
Developer: Playground Games
Release date: TBC 2026
Playground's upcoming RPG, Fable 4, will be the fourth ever game in the series, but the very first under the new developer after Lionhead Studios folded six years after Fable 3. We'd originally thought it a long-awaited sequel, but more recent cinematic sneak peeks from Playground Games have revealed Fable to be more of a series reboot. It's still set in the glittering medieval fantasy kingdom of Albion, and still features that crass tongue-in-cheek British sense of humor we loved about the original trilogy, but the new Fable game is set to bring it into the 2020s with style.
Wax Heads
Developer: Patattie Games
Release date: TBC 2026
Wax Heads is one of our most anticipated cozy games heading to PC and will see you take part in a narrative driven experience where you'll be running a struggling record store. Chat to your customers and discover their music tastes, curate a collection of tunes, and follow your favourite bands. Wax Heads looks like the perfect game to unwind with, and set's itself out from the cozy game pack with its punk-twist. Personally, we can't wait for this one!
There are No Ghosts at the Grand
Developer: Friday Sundae
Release date: TBC 2026
In this charming (and very musical) upcoming PC game, you'll be in charge of restoring an English hotel back to its glory days. However, there's a spooky twist. While you renovate during the day, you'll have to catch ghosts during the night. Uncover a supernatural plot as you not only restore the hotel but the entire village as well. There are No Ghosts at the Grand looks wholly unique and like the perfect blend of story-driven action paired with decorating and combat features.
Beast of Reincarnation
Developer: Game Freak
Release date: TBC 2026

In this stunning new world, a mysterious beast is spreading blight across the land, and it's up to Emma the Sealer to pursue and stop it once and for all. From the upcoming PC game's trailer, it looks like Emma will have plenty of bosses to take down as she and her white wolf companion travel around the setting. We'll keep you posted on a release date, because let's be honest, Beast of Reincarnation already seems like a banger.
At Fate's End

Release date: TBC 2026
Calling all cozy gamers who need a good emotional crisis, the developers behind Spiritfarer (Thunder Lotus) have a new game in the works. Titled At Fate's End, this upcoming action adventure looks magical, stylish, and packed with action. Unlike their last outing, Thunder Lotus is taking a more combat-centred approach with At Fate's End. However, we're still intrigued! Hopefully, we will learn more details soon.
TBC

From what we've seen so far, the story seems to remain largely untouched, and the turn-based party system is still in place. However, hopefully, we see some tweaks to the dungeons and enemy encounters in the future once a release date is announced. Stay tuned for updates!

Fractured Blooms

Chrono Odyssey
Developer: Chrono Studio

Atomic Heart 2
Developer: Mundfish
Release date: TBC

Outbound
